Key Match Events: Shivam Dube scored an unbeaten half-century (60*) to lead India's successful chase of 159 with 15 balls remaining
Rahmanullah Gurbaz and Ibrahim Zadran contributed significantly to Afghanistan's innings, scoring 23 and 42 respectively
Washington Sundar bowled a decent over with just 13 runs conceded in the penultimate over
Rohit Sharma was run out for a duck in the first over of India's chase
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma was run out for a duck in the first over of India's chase after a mix-up with Shubman Gill
India's coach Rahul Dravid had planned to use Yashasvi Jaiswal and Rohit as India's first-choice openers for this T20I series, but a groin injury to Jaiswal forced India to change their plan
India was also without Virat Kohli, who was unavailable for this match for personal reasons
Post-Match Reflections: Shivam Dube enjoyed a more productive return than his captain, though, following up figures of 1 for 9 in two overs with a punchy, unbeaten half-century that headlined India's successful chase of 159
Jitesh Sharma, who is among the most explosive finishers in the IPL, had an early entry point in the ninth over, and he too impressed with 31 off 20 balls
Miscellaneous Highlights: India won by 6 wickets (with 15 balls remaining)
Arshdeep Singh started with a maiden at his home ground
Rahmanullah Gurbaz and Ibrahim Zadran threatened to kick into a higher gear but were dismissed by Axar Patel and Washington Sundar respectively
Mohammad Nabi (42) and Azmatullah Omarzai (29) gave Afghanistan's flagging innings some impetus in the slog overs
India's coach Rahul Dravid had locked in Yashasvi Jaiswal and Rohit as India's first-choice openers for this T20I series but a groin injury to Jaiswal forced India to veer away from their plan
